markdownRemark.html:
Ingredients

Safeway

  • 4 large baking potatoes, cut into French fry strips
  • Frozen peas
  • One 12-ounce bottle of light beer
  • 1 & 1/2 pounds cod fillets, skinned with bones removed
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 bottle of vegetable oil (enough for frying)
  • 2 teaspoons salt
  • 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
  • 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

Cooking Instructions

(Fry fish while chips are cooling in freezer)

Fish

  1. Heat oil to 375째F in a Dutch oven or deep pot. Heat oven to 250째F.
  2. In a large bowl, pour in 1 bottle of beer. Sift 1 & 1/2 cups flour into the bowl, whisking in gently until just combined. Stir in 1/2 tablespoon House Seasoning.
  3. Pat fish dry and season on both sides with salt and pepper. Coat fish in the beer batter, then dredge in 1/2 cup of remaining flour.
  4. Carefully slide fish into oil making sure each piece has room to fry. Turn over frequently, until deep golden and cooked through, 4 to 5 minutes. Remember, fish will continue to fry once removed.
  5. Transfer to a paper towel-lined baking sheet and keep warm in oven.

Chips

  1. Wash and dry potatoes. Cut into french fry shaped strips, and place into bowl of cold water.
  2. Let soak for about 30 minutes. Replace water every 10 minutes or so.
  3. Meanwhile, heat oil to 275째F in a Dutch oven or deep pot.
  4. Remove strips from the water and dry with a towel.
  5. Place a portion of strips into oil, making sure each strip has some space. Remove after 2-3 mintues and place on paper towel-lined cooking sheet.
  6. Put cooking sheet into freezer or fridge for 20-30 minutes.
  7. Heat oil to 375째F.
  8. Remove strips from freezer/fridge, and fry in oil again. Pull strips out of oil when golden brown, or after about 3-5 minutes. Place on paper towel-lined cooking sheet.
  9. Sprinkle with salt, and serve.

House Seasoning

  1. Mix 2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp pepper and 1/2 tsp garlic powder together in small bowl.

Peas

  1. Fill coffee mug 2/3 full with frozen peas. Add splash of tap water.
  2. Microwave on high for 1 minute. Stir peas in mug, then microwave again on high for 1 minute.
